DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course Hormone Administration Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Records whether systemic hormonal agents were administered as first-course treatment at any facility, or the reason they were not given.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Systemic hormonal agents administered as first-course treatment at any facility.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: It is unknown whether a hormonal agent(s) was recommended or administered

ValueMeaning.preferredName: It is unknown whether a hormonal agent(s) was recommended or administered
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: It is unknown whether a hormonal agent(s) was recommended or administered because it is not stated in the patient record. Death certificate-only cases.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hormone therapy was recommended, but it is unknown if it was administered.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hormone therapy was recommended, but it is unknown if it was administered.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormone therapy was recommended, but it is unknown if it was administered.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hormone therapy was not administered because the patient died prior to planned or recommended therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hormone therapy was not administered because the patient died prior to planned or recommended therapy.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormone therapy was not administered because the patient died prior to planned or recommended therapy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hormone therapy was not recommended/administered because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors (I.e., comorbid conditions, advanced age).

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hormone therapy was not recommended/administered because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors (I.e., comorbid conditions, advanced age).
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormone therapy was not recommended/administered because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors (I.e., comorbid conditions, advanced age).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hormone therapy administered as first course therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hormone therapy administered as first course therapy.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormone therapy administered as first course therapy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: None, hormone therapy was not part of the planned first course of therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: None, hormone therapy was not part of the planned first course of therapy.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: None, hormone therapy was not part of the planned first course of therapy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hormone therapy was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but was not administered as part of first-course therapy. No reason was stated in the patient record.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hormone therapy was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but was not administered as part of first-course therapy. No reason was stated in the patient record.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormone therapy was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but was not administered as part of first-course therapy. No reason was stated in the patient record.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hormone therapy was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian. The refusal was noted in the patient record.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hormone therapy was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian. The refusal was noted in the patient record.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hormone therapy was not administered. It was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian. The refusal was noted in the patient record.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects.:The act of administration.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Chemical substances having a specific regulatory effect on the activity of a certain organ or organs. The term was originally applied to substances secreted by various endocrine glands and transported in the bloodstream to the target organs. It is sometimes extended to include those substances that are not produced by the endocrine glands but that have similar effects.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ReferenceDocuments.name: RX Summ--Hormone Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: Hormone therapy consists of a group of drugs that may affect the long-term control of a cancer's growth. It is not usually used as a curative measure.
